clinical_study.brief_title: A ToM Training for People With Multiple Sclerosis: an Efficacy Study.
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Novel Theory of Mind Training for People With Multiple Sclerosis: a Randomised Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Theory of Mind (ToM) is the ability to understand and attribute mental states to ourselves and others. People with Multiple Sclerosis (pwMS) could present an impairment of this ability, with negative consequences on their social relationships and Quality of Life (QoL). We aimed to design and implement a novel ToM rehabilitation training, testing its efficacy on the promotion of emotional and mental states understanding, on QoL and on the alexithymia traits.

primary_outcome.measure: Reading the Mind from the Eyes (RMET)

primary_outcome.description: A measure of both cognitive and affective advanced ToM

secondary_outcome.measure: Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life 54 questionnaire (MSQOL54)
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of Quality of Life in Multiple Sclerosis
A measure of global cognitive level

secondary_outcome.description: A measure of cognitive functions in Multiple Sclerosis

arm_group.description: ToM training was composed of six lessons two times a week. Through several types of stimuli, the trainer worked together with the participant to comprehend and hypothesize interpretations of the emotions and social interactions, providing discussion occasions to enhance the attribution of mental states and emotions. Every lesson had a duration of 45/60 minutes in order to avoid excessive fatigue in the participant.
